phrases: You are such a slowpoke, Rita.
Alright, everyone, stay where you are and listen.
We have some new workers joining us here at the laundry mill today.
Now, ladies, if you would introduce yourselves...
Quit staring at me, would ya?!
And I knock'them to Kingdom Come!
What kind of a cover is that?
I am a former delinquent who decided to turn over a new leaf when her mother fell ill,
So I went to work, but I cannot hide my bad attitude.
It is the optimal cover for this mission.
An elusive phantom killer who is been making a name for himself in the tabloids.
He is been assassinating important people who have shown support for the Commonwealth.
But we have not identified any backers.
We believe he is working alone.
Then we have but to exterminate him.
A man who uses poison gas will be an easy opponent.
We will have to find him first.
I wonder what he is trying to accomplish.
This is nerve gas, is not it?
I thought production of nerve gas was banned by the Geneva Convention.
So where did he get his illegal poison?
Getting the ingredients would be difficult, too.
Which means he is in the Army?
Gas produced before the Convention is lying unused in military storehouses.
You mean inside the London Wall?
The storehouses were built before the second round of construction,
So you would have to go through the military barracks to get to them.
The odds are good that our poisoner lives in those barracks.
No, the Army is a boys' club.
Women would draw too much attention.
And living in the barracks alongside them,
it would be difficult to maintain a manly facade.
None of the boys in class-
Nerve gas would adhere to his clothes.
And the barracks send all of the men's uniforms to a laundry mill for washing.
So we infiltrate the laundry mill and find the uniform that reacts to a pyridine test.
This is going to take some time.
Um, Miss Alice, you cannot just move the desk around without-
I do not like being ordered around!
So that is what she meant by optimal cover.
It does keep people from asking questions.
By the way, Your Highness, why did you come along?
I am a part of the team, too!
You just wanted to see what it was like, did not you?
This may be a foolish question, but...
Who is the master laundress of this establishment?
That would have to be Marilla.
I have heard that you have the greatest skill with the iron.
Then if you have any questions, just ask.
I guess I cannot expect to find it that soon.
I think that is all for this one.
Guess it is time for a break.
But we have not been working an hour.
In two days, we have tested a total of 150 articles of clothing.
But we could not confirm a single reaction to our chemical test.
At this rate, it is going to take us a month.
Those women are all too lazy!
If they would work harder, they could earn more!
You are very strict, are not you, Miss Chise?
Guess it is about time for a break.
Put down the iron, Japan Girl.
You may all rest without me.
You have but one life to live!
Why would you not give everything your best effort?
This is why I told you to take a break!
If we do not give it a rest every so often, people get hurt.
We get paid by the day.
If we get hurt, we cannot earn any money.
We may not like it, but we do what we can to get on.
I do not care who, but one of you get the foreman.
If you cannot pay, then I will run your sorry little mill into the ground.
Is he going to close the mill?
I always said that foreman was useless as a manager!
That is going to put a damper on our plans.
Are we even going to be paid this month?
I did not know this place was in debt.
Are we even going to be paid this month?
Mother's surgery is at the end of the month.
If you cannot pay now, when can you?
We are in the middle of an important discussion!
And I have come with an important proposal.
I am going to buy this laundry mill.
And I will pay off the debt.
That should resolve all the problems, should not it?
Stay out of this, little girl!
We are not playing a game here!
Y-you would really buy the mill, debt and all?
Do not you dare raise your hand against a lady, you piece of garbage!
Do not be such a pigheaded jackass!
She says she is going to buy the mill,
so shut up and sell it to her, dammit!
Come on, what are you even doing?
What were you thinking, buying a mill that is losing money?
If the laundry mill were to close, that would be the end of our mission, would not it?
We just need two more weeks to check all of the soldiers' uniforms.
And we need to keep the mill in business until then, is that it?
You do not have that much money at your disposal, do you?
I am surprised you knew that.
But I do not intend to let the laundry mill be a poor investment.
You intend to make a profit from it?
That is not like you, Miss Chise.
I thought we could do anything with hard work and practice, right?
Do you think it is impossible?
Nothing is impossible for a spy.
Do not you lie to us.
The machines here have always made such terrible noises.
I do not think they have ever seen proper maintenance.
I would believe that from that stingy foreman.
I think if we just fix them up right, they will be able to work that much harder for us.
All we have to do is replace the old parts, and it will be fine!
If we line the machines up according to work sequence,
we can save ourselves a lot of running around.
I imagine they placed them in order of when they were purchased.
I can change that weight to zero.
Then I order you as foreman.
Rearrange the machinery to create the optimal work path.
Right, and we will get all the tools organized while we are at it.
Some of the girls cannot read, so let us have pictures on the signs.
Let us repair these pipes, too.
Princess, may we try the method used in my country?
It is like a new machine!
Some dust got mixed in with the old grease, and clogged it up.
We cleaned it, so it will not stop anymore.
Wait, YOU girls did all this?
Today we will have a fresh start, and work our hardest!
We know an excellent way to do laundry.
When we are sad, we will all laugh
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
It is coming from the laundry mill.
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
It is coming from the laundry mill.
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
So we can cry tears of joy
Now that we have improved our efficiency,
I do not suppose you would like to improve our revenue, as well?
If we wash more, we earn more.
But there is nothing left to wash,
And the Army will not bring more'round til the weekend.
Then we will just have to get some from other sources.
Some of you girls could really shine with a little polish.
Keep lollygagging and it will be dark before we are through!
I am here with a business proposal.
We would like to wash all of your work clothes.
We look forward to working with you!
Let us let them wash our clothes!
Were not you just complaining about their sloppy work?
I suppose we could see how you do.
That is an awful lot of clothes.
We had a lot of success, thanks to our excellent saleslady.
You are all so pretty, I hardly recognize you!
Miss Dorothea taught us how to wear makeup.
Let us get these clothes in the machines.
It is the income and expense report for the laundry mill Princess purchased.
They have increased revenue 231 since last year.
What the hell are they doing?
I thought their job was to find Poison Gas Jack!
Wasting their time on these frivolities!
What does D say about it?
That it was a necessary measure in continuing the mission.
I left it on my bed.
They came around collecting laundry, so I gave it to them for you.
It is just, this guy always does his own laundry!
He did not want your help, Mate.
Have to do it the way Mummy taught you?
Let us do our best to earn a living
When we are tired, we will all sing
So we can stop our sighing
You can use this if you wish.
So we can stop our sighing
So we can stop our sighing
When we are sad, we will all laugh
When we are sad, we will all laugh
When we are sad, we will all laugh
When we are sad, we will all laugh
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
We want to go see our mothers and fathers
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
In my country, we use them to rouse our fighting spirit.
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
When we want to cry, we will all laugh
So we can cry tears of joy.
You have a way of attracting things.
His unit's barracks is right above the storehouse.
I will go get the car.
Put the evidence in this bag.
None who work here feel the need to walk with such cat-like tread.
Miss Chieko and the others have not come to work in days.
You do not think they have tummyaches, do you?
Ladies, would you all come here, please?
Why are we having a meeting?
Are our wages going up again?
I have decided to step down as foreman.
I still have so much to learn!
They did not even say goodbye!
We have had people quit before, remember?
I am sure they have their reasons.
Forcing you to stay would only make us all uncomfortable.
And so, about your new foreman...
I was hoping I could ask you, Marilla.
Then we have nothing to worry about!
Then who else could I ask to do it?
If Marilla will not do it, I will!
And I will give everyone three lunch breaks!
I will turn the mill into a flower garden!
We are counting on you, Marilla!
But I will not be as forgiving as Priscilla!
Would you tell Chieko something for me?
I do not really know what is going on in her life...
Tell her, Do not let it beat you.
You think the girls at the laundry mill will get on without us?
I am certain they will be fine.
